item.title: ConnieK add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "Whatever you are, be a good one." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: ConnieK add a quote by Mike Dooley
item.description: "There are no tough times, hard knocks, or challenges that aren't laden with emeralds, rubies, and diamonds for those who see them through. " -- Mike Dooley

item.title: ConnieK add a quote by Sam Keen
item.description: "Deep summer is when laziness finds respectability." -- Sam Keen

item.title: ConnieK add a quote by Oprah Winfrey
item.description: "Life is about becoming more of who you really are...." -- Oprah Winfrey

item.title: ConnieK add a quote by “The Abraham’ Teachers" (Ester & Jerry Hicks)
item.description: "The greatest gift that you could ever give another is the expectation of their success." -- “The Abraham’ Teachers" (Ester & Jerry Hicks)

item.title: ConnieK add a quote by Eckhart Tolle
item.description: "Acknowledging the good that you already have in your life is the foundation for all abundance." -- Eckhart Tolle

item.title: ConnieK add a quote by Pat Conroy
item.description: "My mother, Southern to the bone, once told me, “All Southern literature can be summed up in these words: ‘On the night the hogs ate Willie, Mama died when she heard what Daddy did to Sister.’” She raised me up to be a Southern writer, but it wasn’t easy." -- Pat Conroy

item.title: ConnieK add a quote by Richard Russo
item.description: "As I drift back into sleep, I can't help thinking that it's a wonderful thing to be right about the world. To weigh the evidence, always incomplete, and correctly intuit the whole, to see the world in a grain of sand, to recognize its beauty, its simplicity, its truth. It's as close as we get to God in this life, and reside in the glow of such brief flashes of understanding, fully awake, sometimes for two or three seconds, at peace with our existence. And then back to sleep we go." -- Richard Russo

item.title: ConnieK add a quote by Richard Russo
item.description: "It pleased him to imagine God as someone like his mother, someone beleagured by too many responsibilities, too dog-tired to monitor an energetic boy every minute of the day, but who, out of love and fear for his safety, checked in on him whenever she could. Was this so crazy? ...Miles liked the idea of a God who, when He at last had the oppotunity to return His attention to His children, might shake His head with wonder and mutter, "Jesus. Look what they're up to now." A distractible God, perhaps, one who'd be startled to discover so many of His children way up in trees since the last time He looked. A God whose hand would go rushing to His mouth in fear in that instant of recognition that - good God! - that kid's going to hurt himself. A God who could be surprised by unanticipated pride - glory be, that boy is a climber!" -- Richard Russo

item.title: ConnieK add a quote by Marianne Williamson
item.description: "Children are happy because they don't have a file in their minds called "All the Things That Could Go Wrong." -- Marianne Williamson

item.title: ConnieK add a quote by Warren Buffett
item.description: "Somebody once said that in looking for people to hire, you look for three qualities: integrity, intelligence, and energy. And if you don’t have the first, the other two will kill you. You think about it; it’s true. If you hire somebody without [integrity], you really want them to be dumb and lazy." -- Warren Buffett

item.title: ConnieK add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description:
"Never put off till tomorrow what may be done day after tomorrow just as well".
From: "More Maxims of Mark" -- Mark Twain

item.title: ConnieK add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "Everyone thinks of changing the world, but no one thinks of changing himself." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: ConnieK add a quote by Billy Sunday
item.description: "Going to church doesn’t make you a Christian any more than going to a garage makes you an automobile." -- Billy Sunday

item.title: ConnieK add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Live in each season as it passes; breathe the air, drink the drink, taste the fruit, and resign yourself to the influence of the earth." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: ConnieK add a quote by Mike Dooley
item.description: "There can only be a need for forgiveness when first there is blame. And there can only be blame, when first there is misunderstanding." -- Mike Dooley

item.title: ConnieK add a quote by Garth Stein
item.description: "He died that day because his body had served its purpose. His soul had done what it came to do, learned what it came to learn, and then was free to leave." -- Garth Stein

item.title: ConnieK add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "There are only two ways to live your life. One is as though nothing is a miracle. The other is as though everything is a miracle." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: ConnieK add a quote by H. Jackson Brown Jr.
item.description: "Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things that you didn't do than by the ones you did do. So throw off the bowlines. Sail away from the safe harbor. Catch the trade winds in your sails. Explore. Dream. Discover." -- H. Jackson Brown Jr.

item.title: ConnieK add a quote by Joseph Campbell
item.description: "When you follow your bliss...doors will open where you would not have thought there would be doors, and where there wouldn't be a door for anyone else. " -- Joseph Campbell

item.title: ConnieK add a quote by Muriel Barbery
item.description: "I may be indigent in name, position, and in appearance, but in my own mind I am an unrivaled goddess -" -- Muriel Barbery
